intro: Rauvolfia media, commonly known as Indian snakeroot, is a tropical climbing plant native to regions of India and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers followed by berries that contain the seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and gardens. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both traditional medicine and horticulture.
